Panettone French Toast with Poached Fresh Peaches

Serves 2

Source of Recipe Ben 0’Donoghue

Preparation Time Less than 10 mins

Cooking Time 10 to 30 mins

Ingredients
  • 1L/1¾pt mineral water
  • 500g/1lb2oz caster sugar
  • 1 lemon, zest peeled in strips with a peeler, lemon then halved for juicing
  • 2 vanilla pods, split lengthways
  • ½ cinnamon stick
  • 1 star anise
  • 3 ripe peaches
  • 2 eggs
  • splash of milk
  • 2 large slices or 4 smaller slices of panettone, cut in half diagonally
  • 25g/1oz unsalted butter
  • caster sugar and cinnamon to taste
  • extra thick double cream to serve
Method

  1. Make a sugar syrup with the water and sugar. Add the lemon zest and a squeeze of juice, vanilla pods, cinnamon stick and star anise and boil for 5 minutes.

  2. Remove from the heat, add the peaches and allow to cool. (Placing a plate on top will keep them immersed). When cooled, remove the peaches and peel. Halve them and remove the stone. Cut the flesh into slices.

  3. Meanwhile, whisk the eggs and milk together in a shallow dish. Soak the panetonne slices in the egg wash for 1 minute. Melt the butter in a small frying pan and gently pan-fry the bread for 1-2 minutes on each side until golden brown and set. Remove and drain on kitchen paper.

  4. Sprinkle with caster sugar and cinnamon to taste.

  5. Serve the toasted bread topped with the poached peaches, drizzle a little syrup over and serve with a dollop of double cream.

Published: July 22 2012
